EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Stone Furnace Facility at position (0.0, 0.0)
Use-case: Smelting basic materials.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (0.0, 0.0)
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)

### Iron Ore Mining Setup at position (–16.0, –51.0)
Use-case: Extraction and preliminary processing of iron ore.
Consists of:
– Burner Mining Drill at (–16.0, –51.0)
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –49.5) with:
  • Pickup at (–15.5, –49.5)
  • Drop at (–13.5, –49.5)
– Transport Belt at (–15.5, –49.5)
– Iron Chest at (–13.5, –49.5)
– Burner Inserter at (–14.5, –47.5) with:
  • Pickup at (–15.5, –47.5)
  • Drop at (–13.5, –47.5)
– Fast Inserter at (–12.5, –49.5)
– Sink Inserter at (–13.5, –45.5) with:
  • Pickup at (–13.5, –46.5)
  • Drop at (–13.5, –44.5)
– Belt Group connecting the fast inserter drop at (–11.5, –49.5) to the sink inserter pickup at (–13.5, –46.5)

### Copper Furnace at position (–27.0, –60.0)
Use-case: Processing copper ore.
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (–27.0, –60.0)

### Lab Power Integration System at position (0.5, 2.5)
Use-case: Supporting research with integrated power and fluid supply.
Consists of:
– Lab at (0.5, 2.5)
– Offshore Pump (original) at (–7.5, 25.5)
– Offshore Pump (new) at (–9.5, 24.5) connected to the boiler
– Boiler at (2.0, 17.5)
– Steam Engine (Generator) at (2.5, 27.5) with an unresolved fluid connection due to persistent congestion near (2.5, 21.5)

### Pipe Production Facility at position (3.5, 0.5)
Use-case: Manufacturing of pipes.
Consists of:
– Assembling Machine at (3.5, 0.5) (warning: not receiving electricity and cannot create pipe due to missing resource: iron-plate)
– Iron Chest at (1.5, 0.5)
– Electricity network established through Small Electric Poles distributed over the area

### Fluid Pipelines (Pipe Groups)
Use-case: Interconnecting fluid transport components.
Consists of:
– Multiple Pipe Groups distributed across the map (e.g., around (8.5, 5.5), (10.5, 4.5), (2.5, 9.5), (1.5, 11.5), (–1.5, 17.5), (0.5, 17.5), (6.5, 16.5), etc.)
– A key Pipe Group linking the Offshore Pump at (–9.5, 24.5) to the Boiler at (2.0, 17.5)
– A congested connection near (2.5, 21.5) that continues to affect fluid input to the Steam Engine

### Integrated Components
Use-case: Facilitating power distribution and resource integration.
Consists of:
– Belt connections linking outputs of mining and inserter setups
– An electricity network formed by Small Electric Poles and associated distribution links

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
• Fluid Pipeline Congestion and Layout Collisions  
  – The connection between the Boiler (2.0, 17.5) and the Steam Engine (2.5, 27.5) remains unresolved because of persistent congestion near (2.5, 21.5).
  – Numerous pipe groups and interfering entities cause collisions despite testing multiple candidate directions (RIGHT, UP, LEFT, DOWN with spacings 2, 3, 4).
  – Mitigate by reconfiguring or relocating obstructing pipe groups, deploying underground pipelines or pipe-to-ground modules, and rerouting the connection to a less congested area.

• Fuel and Resource Provisioning  
  – Warnings such as “out of fuel” and “no ingredients to smelt” observed at furnaces, drills, inserters, and boilers indicate insufficient fuel or resource inputs.
  – Ensure adequate fuel reserves and verify resource availability before placement.

• Electrical Connectivity Issues  
  – Alerts like “not receiving electricity” and “not connected to power network” for components such as Fast Inserters and Assembling Machines point to unresolved power network links.
  – Confirm that all electrical devices are properly connected to a robust power grid.

• Inventory and Placement Validations  
  – Errors like inability to create a pipe due to a missing iron-plate emphasize the need for pre-placement inventory checks and verification that target locations are unobstructed.
  – Always perform inventory checks and confirm placement availability prior to construction.
